text: You can call them at <tel:1-888-482-7768|1-888-482-7768> x3 <@UDARG2NKZ>

Thanks! I enjoyed the videos a lot, great quality and production :slightly_smiling_face: The one thing I might suggest to improve is written instructions. I know there are transcripts, but these are very lacking in the way syntax and code is provided.

Is the email drag and drop still beta?
This article doesn’t mention it but i don’t have it in one of my portals, does anyone know if there’s a way to activate it?
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/email/create-marketing-emails-in-the-drag-and-drop-email-editor>
<#CES6JU0RY|drag-drop-email-beta>  ask very nicely, and you’ll likely get an invite from Shay
i did not ask and i still have it in my portal
with Sankt patrick days templates
They were planning to roll it out to everyone the end of last month or this month(forget which)
ooh didn’t know there was a channel for it, we have it in at least one of our portals without requesting it, Thanks for the heads up!
Yea, I’d assume they’re rolling it out in waves essentially to make sure there aren’t any issues
Does anyone know if its possible to add an active class to the first element in a repeater?
Hey Scott, you could try {% if loop.first %}class="active"{% endif %} or something like that to accomplish this (<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/for-loops#loop-properties>).
Thanks

agh, HubSpot staff can you guys please make it so the blog content module allows fields and custom module snippets inside it again. it’s really making creating blog detail pages frustrating having the parser reject it all.

It used to be allowed, I understand it likely was a change due to the blog content module being turned into a true custom module. and now having to follow those rules but it becomes a royal pain.

we have a custom module we use for the sharing widgets. and it displays right in with the author and all that. currently the only way to implement is to completely not use the blog content module at all.

actually I’ll be honest without using javascript to hack my thing into the correct place I don’t know how to create this layout for blog posts anymore.

Our posts usually look something like this:
<https://spin.d.pr/12rVM1+>

another problem this change caused was that we can’t have hubl tags in blog posts without resorting to a hack, making it hard to add custom data to the post.

Created an idea for this because it’s frustrating <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Add-back-support-for-the-use-of-HubL-tags-inside-of-the-blog/idi-p/259774#M31488>
i thought it was just me

So riddle me this one, I have a client who has a portal (we'll call it `<http://abc.com|abc.com>`) and then there is a user on their portal from a domain `<http://xyz.com|xyz.com>` so when sending email, they are sending from the `<http://xyz.com|xyz.com>` domain even though that domain is not listed in their domains area or connected as an email domain.
This is allowed?
I thought the domain needed to be added to the email domain before you could send from it

Connecting the email sending domain should remove the via HubSpot in the from address but you should be able to send out emails without connecting the email sending domain (I believe the tool prevents marketing email sends from personal email addresses like gmail or yahoo).
Ah ok, I was just confused as I know they are moving to that new domain but I didnt see any of it in the domain stuff. Thanks Jason!
No problem :thumbsup:

it seems custom modules work fine for a coded blog template.
obviously doesn't help too much if your theme is utilizing drag-n-drop templates for all the layout/styling though :(
it’s not, it seems any portals created after the forced upgrade to DM2 have this problem
yeah, atleast converting the template is an option, still not going to make my clients happy though
thank you for the heads up that it still works on that front

np, though your finding made me concerned for how we present some of our content.
one of my company's clients is utilizing a Blog to create pillar-page content and I had made a custom module to get pseudo `Flexible Column` functionality so they can just focus on creating content instead of having to figure out how/what default modules to use
got nervous thinking i'd have to figure out how to get their current content if that had broke lol
yeah I’ve done a lot of similar crazy stuff, and it really screws you over if you’re building with the drag n drop builder for blogs

ours is special, we used a CM to simplify it’s code.

It grabs post counts, you can hover the icons for their counts and whatnot. we reuse this on a lot of sites so using a custom module makes this significantly faster and easier.
